<p>I would also add an example using <code>'</code> around the argument containing blanks, for instance <code>"--format pretty features --tags 'not @jruby'"</code> (which also avoids the path separator problem), to be very sure that both <code>"</code> and <code>'</code> can be used to define arguments with blanks in them.</p>

B5YG6TPPA
2017-06-26 14:01:19

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne requested changes to #1132: Adds scenario for the ambiguous step reporting

<p>If you tag this feature as <code>@wip</code> then (I think) it will be expected to fail in CI, so your branch will stay green. Once we have it passing we can remove the <code>@wip</code> tag.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r124119310">Comment by mattwynne on line 1 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
<p>It would be good to add some documentation here about this feature. Something like:</p> <pre><code>When Cucumber searches for a step definition for a step, it might find multiple step definitions that could match. In that case, it will give you an error that the step definitions are ambiguous. You can also use a `--guess` mode, where it uses magic powers to try and figure out which of those two step definitions is most likely to be the one you meant it to use. Use it with caution! </code></pre>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r124120183">Comment by mattwynne on line 2 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
<p>I tend to not even bother naming scenarios used as tests unless it adds something to the documentation. In this case I suggest you can leave it blank.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r124118653">Comment by mattwynne on line 9 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
<p>I'm wondering why we need this second scenario. I'd find it easier to read this example if it wasn't there. Do we need it to illustrate the behaviour?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r124118497">Comment by mattwynne on line 13 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-06-26 14:05:18

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] tooky commented on #1132: Adds scenario for the ambiguous step reporting

<p>@matt it's there because the current behaviour is that it just crashes the whole test run and doesn't run he second scenario. </p> <p>I suppose that if it reported the status correctly it wouldn't matter how many scenarios there are. </p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r124121914">Comment by tooky on line 13 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-06-27 01:26:14

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:23:31

@enkessler what’s the status of the windows build at the moment? Should we be expecting the AppVeyor messages in PRs to be red still?

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:24:04

@olleolleolle are you any kind of JRuby afficionado? Do you know what we can do about random failures like https://travis-ci.org/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/jobs/248090221 ?

olleolleolle
2017-06-30 07:27:40

@matt-SmartBear The kind where it "runs on forever"?

olleolleolle
2017-06-30 07:27:54

@matt-SmartBear Or the kinds where it never starts?

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:28:41

It’s hard to tell which it is @olleolleolle. But I’d bet that the rerun of that same revision (which I’m running now) won’t fail in the same way on JRuby.

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:28:59

I’ve also noticed that the JRuby tests have started taking a ridiculously long time.

enkessler
2017-06-30 07:46:17

@matt-SmartBear Yes, the Windows build is going to be red until the remaining test failures are fixed. A lot of them are failing around the child processes created via Aruba (and ultimately through ChildProcess).

enkessler
2017-06-30 07:46:57

Some tests try to redirect output to /dev/null which, naturally, does not exist on Windows.

enkessler
2017-06-30 07:48:23

I keep running into System can not find the file specified but I don't see anything about the test that is trying to use files that don't exist.

enkessler
2017-06-30 07:49:22

If I don't used fancy libraries like Aruba and simply use backticks to execute the test command then it works fine but when I use the helper libraries then it blows up.

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:50:17

OK. It sounds like it will take a fair bit of investigation to get them all passing.

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:51:30

I’m worried it will confuse people submitting (or merging) PRs if there’s a failing build from AppVeyor

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:51:48

I suggest we tag out the current failures as @todo-windows and exclude those from the windows build for now.

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 07:52:09

Then we can gradually fix them and add them back in. WDYT @enkessler?

enkessler
2017-06-30 08:03:20

In the interest of allowing people to reasonably think that they have not made things worse, yes, filtering out the Windows failures with tags is an acceptable solution. But it would be REALLY NICE if getting it green could be high priority from some of us.

enkessler
2017-06-30 08:03:50

I've already smacked my head against the wall for hours so at the very least I need a different set of eyes on it other than my own.

enkessler
2017-06-30 08:04:59

We could rewrite some of the tests so that they don't use Aruba/etc. to make new process and just stick with the POpen family of methods and that would avoid the problem.

enkessler
2017-06-30 08:05:18

But it that would just be avoiding the issue.

enkessler
2017-06-30 08:05:42

And ignoring potential bugs in those other libraries.

maxmeyer
2017-06-30 08:11:27

@maxmeyer has joined the channel

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 09:25:37

@enkessler if we get master back to green, then we can have a PR that isolates one example of those failures, I’ll happily give it some attention if I have a focussed example like that to work with. I can also push to that branch and get feedback from AppVeyor.

enkessler
2017-06-30 09:32:00

Sounds like a plan.

👍 matt-SmartBear

enkessler

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 09:58:21

*Thread Reply:* @enkessler hey don’t you have a tool that can automatically add tags to feature files? 🙂

enkessler
2017-06-30 10:09:14

*Thread Reply:* Yes.

matt-SmartBear
2017-06-30 10:09:40

*Thread Reply:* Would it work to tag these scenarios out, or is it easier just to do it by hand?

enkessler
2017-06-30 10:10:33

*Thread Reply:* About the same. The tool can update the file for you but you've got to give it the tag and the file:line location of the test.

enkessler
2017-06-30 10:11:15

*Thread Reply:* So it's handy for reusable processing scripts but less useful for a one-off task.

enkessler
2017-06-30 10:11:43

*Thread Reply:* It's the cuketagger gem.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #1140: Emulate Cucumber-JS's new i18n CLI options

<p>Now that this method is shorter, could you swap this logic around round to use a <a href="https://refactoring.com/catalog/replaceNestedConditionalWithGuardClauses.html">Guard Clause</a>?</p> <p>i.e. <code>return indicate_invalid_language_and_exit(lang) if !::Gherkin::DIALECTS.keys.include? lang list_keywords_and_exit(lang) </code></p>

B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-04 00:57:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] tooky commented on #1132: Adds scenario for the ambiguous step reporting

<p>I think the other thing that's important for this scenario is to see the summary report:</p> <p><code>1 scenario (1 failed) 2 steps (1 failed, 1 passed) 0m0.012s </code></p> <p>I think we see an error like this in the current behaviour, but it also drops out of the running cucumber process and doesn't print the summary report?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1132#discussion_r125410206">Comment by tooky on line 45 of features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-04 04:22:12

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #1138: Extract HtmlBuilder class

<p>I'd use a private <code>attr_reader</code> for <code>builder</code> here. Sandi Metz taught me to basically never use instance variables.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1138#discussion_r125450054">Comment by mattwynne on line 49 of lib/cucumber/formatter/html.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-04 04:24:15

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #1138: Extract HtmlBuilder class

2017-07-05 00:28:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne approved #1133: Fixing the profile loader

<p>I think we should merge this anyway, and we can improve the tests from master if you have the enthusiasm @enkessler </p>
<p>I don't really understand what's going on with the backslashes in these tests! 😁 </p> <p>This one uses two, but the one on line 47 uses one. And the expected parsed output on non-windows OSes has no slashes in the path?!</p> <p>I realise this is code we've inherited from our ancestors, but now that you've looked at it, are you able to explain what it means @enkessler?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1133#discussion_r125571147">Comment by mattwynne on line 33 of spec/cucumber/cli/profile_loader_spec.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-06 01:12:12

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] brasmusson commented on #1133: Fix the profile loader on Windows

<p>@mattwynne From the irb: <code>irb(main):004:0&amp;gt; puts 'dir\file' dir\file =&amp;gt; nil irb(main):005:0&amp;gt; puts "dir\file" dir ile =&amp;gt; nil irb(main):006:0&amp;gt; puts "dir\\file" dir\file =&amp;gt; nil </code> Within <code>""</code> the <code>\</code> is interpreted as "escape" so if you literally mean <code>\</code> you have to use <code>\\</code>, which when the <code>""</code> expression is "evaluted" is "converted" to <code>\</code>. (<code>\f</code> in the <code>""</code> expression above means <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/a/31791519">"formfead"</a>)</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1133#discussion_r125836226">Comment by brasmusson on line 33 of spec/cucumber/cli/profile_loader_spec.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-06 05:46:12

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #1133: Fix the profile loader on Windows

<p>Thanks @brassmusson, that makes sense.</p> <p>I'm still puzzled why the expected output on non-windows has no slashes in the path at all though. What's going on there?!</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1133#discussion_r125887879">Comment by mattwynne on line 33 of spec/cucumber/cli/profile_loader_spec.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-06 05:51:13

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] enkessler commented on #1133: Fix the profile loader on Windows

<p>I think you're right.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1133#discussion_r125888910">Comment by enkessler on line 23 of spec/cucumber/cli/profile_loader_spec.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-06 05:56:13

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] enkessler commented on #1133: Fix the profile loader on Windows

<p>I don't know why the output is different either but I just copy/paste/tweaked for the new test.</p> <p>As for why a certain number of backslashes are needed...well...they are basically <a href="https://xkcd.com/1638/">magic</a>. ;)</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1133#discussion_r125890112">Comment by enkessler on line 33 of spec/cucumber/cli/profile_loader_spec.rb</a>

Rake task fix_cr_lf: exclude iso-8859-1 files by olleolleolle · Pull Request #1153 · cucumber/cucumber-ruby
This PR changes the fix_cr_lf Rake task: it now fixes CRLF on the right files. The previous exclusion rules were for files with dos in the filename – these files are no longer a part of the codebase.

B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-13 10:51:17

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core] brasmusson commented on #140: Make the Summary report able to say if the total result is ok.

<p>When I put that method last in the module after a <code>private</code> modifier:</p> <pre><code>```def self.ok?(type, be_strict = false) .. </code></pre> <pre><code>Then rubocop issued the warning: ```private (on line xxx) does not make singleton methods private. Use private_class_method or private inside a class &amp;lt;&amp;lt; self block instead. </code></pre> <p>Then I changed it like it is now (and rubocop does not comment on it), so my conclusion is that it makes the <code>self.ok?</code> private to the module.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/140#discussion_r127285516">Comment by brasmusson on line 12 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-13 11:54:16

<p>When I was making my recent PRs with Rubocop fixes I opted not to change the indentation in this file and to keep it excluded for the reason @nodo gave.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core] brasmusson requested changes to #139: Add ambiguous result type

<p>This PR needs to be rebased since #140 has made some ground work for adding new result types.</p>
<p>These symbols definitions has been moved to a module level constant, so <code>:ambiguous</code> should be added there instead, and since the order control the order in the summary listing, I think is should be defined directly after <code>:failed</code></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/139#discussion_r127613150">Comment by brasmusson on line 5 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
<p>The ambiguous result should describe itself as <code>ambiguous</code> to the visitors (which also requires and <code>ambiguous</code> method in the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/blob/master/lib/cucumber/core/test/runner.rb#L82"><code>RunningTestCase</code></a> - same definition as <code>undefined</code> works)</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/139#discussion_r127613254">Comment by brasmusson on line 17 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
<p>&gt; starting with the even more basic case of failure In that case, an <code>Ambiguous</code> class should not be defined here, so defining it here implies a new result category in the summary (<code>N Scenarios (X failed, Y ambiguous, ... )</code></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/139#discussion_r127613097">Comment by brasmusson on line 23 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
<p>Now the <code>ok?</code> methods are defined as class methods - and for <code>Ambiguous</code> is should always be <code>false</code> (as long as the scenarios says <code>Then it should fail with</code>) </p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/139#discussion_r127613319">Comment by brasmusson on line 26 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
<p>But the feature file says <a href="https://github.com/MadameSheema/cucumber-ruby/blob/b39f24fdedaf39f67c0dc989bc2ee05548cbd2fa/features/docs/defining_steps/ambiguous_steps.feature#L36"><code>Then it should fail with:</code></a>, and if it is not bad unless <code>--strict</code> then the scenario should say <code>Then it should pass with:</code></p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core/pull/139#discussion_r127613006">Comment by brasmusson on line 27 of lib/cucumber/core/test/result.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-20 12:28:17

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #919: Format tables including full width characters properly

<p>I'm wondering why this is a development dependency. Won't we need it at runtime too? Or is the idea that we'll expect users to have to have installed it themselves if they want to benefit from it?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128609486">Comment by mattwynne on line 4 of cucumber.gemspec</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-20 12:38:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne requested changes to #919: Format tables including full width characters properly

<p>Hi @soutaro,</p> <p>I'm terribly sorry it's taken so long to give you feedback on this, and I'm really grateful to you for sharing your code with us.</p> <p>I took the time this week to try and merge your PR, and I realised it was going to take more work than I had time for in that session. So I've written up what I would have done myself as review comments. If you (or anyone else reading!) wants to pick up those review comments and action them, I think this would be ready to merge.</p>
<p>I think having this option is fine, but we need to add it to <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/master/lib/cucumber/configuration.rb">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/master/lib/cucumber/configuration.rb</a> instead.</p> <p>This has implications for how we use it in the <code>DataTable</code>, but we can figure that out.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128609815">Comment by mattwynne on line 4 of lib/cucumber.rb</a>
<p>This code looks quite similar to what's in <code>DataTable::Cells#width</code> below. If we move that logic into a <code>Cell#width</code> method, could we re-use that logic here by constructing an instance of a <code>Cell</code>?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128611191">Comment by mattwynne on line 5 of lib/cucumber/formatter/pretty.rb</a>
<p>let's extract a <code>Cell#width</code> method here and call it.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128610100">Comment by mattwynne on line 6 of lib/cucumber/multiline_argument/data_table.rb</a>
<p>Instead of using the global option here, let's accept this specific option as a constructor parameter (using an options hash or keyword argument would be best IMO) into the <code>DataTable</code> and pass it down to the <code>Cell</code>.</p> <p>Wherever we construct instances of <code>DataTable</code> we'll almost certainly have access to an instance of the <code>configuration</code> where we can read that setting from.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128610682">Comment by mattwynne on line 9 of lib/cucumber/multiline_argument/data_table.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-07-20 12:42:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] mattwynne commented on #919: Format tables including full width characters properly

<p>I also suggest we rename it to <code>treat_ambiguous_width_characters_as_double_width</code> to be crystal clear.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/919#discussion_r128612618">Comment by mattwynne on line 4 of lib/cucumber.rb</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] olleolleolle commented on #1187: Extract HTMLBuilder#stringtoembed method to DRY up code

<p>I noted a <em>thing</em> about exceptions. </p>
<p>If you wish to golf more this error could introduce a VALID<em>EMBED</em>TYPES constant, pull up the interpolated message into its own constructor, and <code>super(that_interpolated_message)</code> there. </p> <p>This line could then <code>unless VALID_EMBED_TYPES.include?(type)</code>.</p> <p>If this appeals to you, go for it, if not, let it go. </p>

2017-09-20 17:45:18

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Ben-Behar commented on #1200: Fix for issue: #1199: Changed DataTable#symbolic_hashes to not change the state of the table

<p>• <code>build_hashes</code> is called above on line 147 within the method <code>hashes</code>, which in turn is called on line 163. • <code>@header_conversion_proc</code> is used elsewhere and the modification to this variable in <code>@symbolic_hashes</code> is what is/was causing the issue.</p> <p>Personally, I wouldn't mind removing usage of <code>@header_conversion_proc</code> throughout the file as it seems a bit unnecessary. However, I think that is outside the scope of this bugfix.</p>

B5YG6TPPA
2017-09-28 11:40:23

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby-core] brasmusson requested changes to #129: Fix issue #128

<p>This PR cannot be merged (merge conflicts aside) because</p> <p>• if it would 5 rspec examples and 13 feature scenarios of <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a> starts to fail. So a PR for <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a> that when merged when this PR would be merged, the test of <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a> passes. • Even though several of the instances of behavior changes of <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a> are intentional (as the data produced by the Json formatter), this PR also breaks the <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/master/features/docs/gherkin/outlines.feature#L63-L65"><code>outline.feature</code></a> which should not change. Of course I am biased about this since I implemented that behavior, but I do believe that the stack trace should look like that (when read from the bottom); "from the outline step at line 6 <code>Given &amp;lt;state&amp;gt; without a table</code>, when it is expanded by the example row at line 12 to <code>Given failing without a table</code>, then the step definition <code>/^failing without a table$/</code> is called, and that step definition failed".</p> <p>I do not think there is a simple fix for #128, I think that the expanded step needs to know both the line of the outline step and the line of the example row, and be able to provide each of these to other classes requiring one or the other. It it quite likely that it when quacking like a step should return the outline step location, but it need also be able to provide the specific location, for outline step or example row, when asked for it.</p>
B5YG6TPPA

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] olleolleolle commented on #1045: Fixes Style/IndentArray

<p>Hi! I found a thing and typed a comment about it. On a phone, no less. </p> <p>(It’s super that you make the code more compliant.)</p>
<p>Perhaps someone already noted this, but all the places where the rule AlignArray has been explicitly disabled, those places in the code are carefully arranged ASCII art of a sort. </p> <p>The code indentation there explains levels of nesting and ordering. </p> <p>Could you make those align in a harmonious way in this change? I mean: Avoid four-space indents. </p>

2017-10-29 09:31:14

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] brasmusson commented on #1228: Fix Style/AccessorMethodName

<p>Updating the Changelog in a pull-request will most likely lead to merge conflict (with Changelog changes in other pull-requests). AFAIK out guideline is that the person the merges a pull-request updates the Changelog, instead of the pull-request author (in the pull-request).</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1228#discussion_r147586691">Comment by brasmusson on line 4 of CHANGELOG.md</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-10-29 09:49:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] brasmusson commented on #1228: Fix Style/AccessorMethodName

<p>I really feel that "Changed" is the wrong heading in the Changelog for these kind of changes. I think "Changed" should mean "different behavior compared to the previous release" - think that a user need to examine carefully before starting to use a new version. Things not affecting the behavior should be placed under other headings like "Refactoring / Developer Experience" as in v3.0.0.pre.2 of "Improved" as in v3.0.0.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1228#discussion_r147587118">Comment by brasmusson on line 4 of CHANGELOG.md</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2017-11-19 03:32:18

<p>Entering the else clause will print "Example row" in the report, so that is wrong, we need to enter the then clause - but not use <code>@failing_step_source</code> unless it exists.</p>

B5YG6TPPA
2018-01-07 13:13:23

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] olleolleolle requested changes to #1226: Fix Lint/HandleExceptions

<p>I made a remark about one specific LoadError handling.</p>
<p>This is one of those place where we <em>want</em> to silence the LoadError and not caring about it.</p> <p>For ancient Rake versions before that version, this file won't exist (and won't be necessary) and Ruby will raise the LoadError. We catch that and silence that error, telling Ruby: "This is normal."</p> <p>So, we want to silence RuboCop's complaining about this specific LoadError silencing.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1226#discussion_r160060397">Comment by olleolleolle on line 4 of lib/cucumber/rake/task.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2018-01-07 13:19:23

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] olleolleolle commented on #1227: Fix Lint/IneffectiveAccessModifier

<p>The only usage <em>here</em> seems to be in the CLI options-creating one-liner.</p> <p>I'm not fully familiar with the <code>glue/</code> code - I can not say whether this is used anywhere else. What the code <em>does</em> indicates that it's quite local. </p> <p>Alternative: If it truly is local, it could be made a local variable instead of its own method.</p> <p>Alternative 2: Do not change the visibility of this method in this PR.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1227#discussion_r160060687">Comment by olleolleolle on line 4 of lib/cucumber/glue/snippet.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2018-01-07 13:33:24

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] jaysonesmith commented on #1226: Fix Lint/HandleExceptions

<p>I've pushed a new version without this. :)</p>

<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1227#discussion_r160074189">Comment by jaysonesmith on line 4 of lib/cucumber/glue/snippet.rb</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2018-01-08 00:51:26

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] olleolleolle requested changes to #1228: Fix Style/AccessorMethodName

<p>I skimmed the PR and found two things which can be modified.</p> <p>The <code>to_green</code> name is less good than <code>get_to_green</code>, we need another method name wording which obeys the rule.</p>
<p>An issue with this rename: the name is not the name of a getter, but the expression "Get to green", which is lingo from the Agile community about TDD. </p> <p>Example of this lingo in use: <a href="https://blog.carbonfive.com/2011/01/12/tdd-getting-to-green-one-small-step-at-a-time/">https://blog.carbonfive.com/2011/01/12/tdd-getting-to-green-one-small-step-at-a-time/</a> </p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1228#discussion_r160092958">Comment by olleolleolle on line 5 of lib/autotest/cucumber_mixin.rb</a>
<p>TODO: This is a conflict marker, which should not be in the resulting file. </p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1228#discussion_r160092786">Comment by olleolleolle on line 21 of CHANGELOG.md</a>
B5YG6TPPA

[cucumber/cucumber-rails] xtrasimplicity requested changes to #352: Remove Rack::Test::Methods from the default World.

<p>This is looking good, however we'll need to add some tests to make sure that it functions as expected (and doesn't negatively impact existing functionality).</p> <p>Thanks!</p>
<p>You can simplify this method by removing the two lines and replacing them with <code>@use_rack_test_helpers || true</code>. If <code>@use_rack_test_helpers</code> is undefined it will be evaluated to false, thus <code>true</code> would be returned. :)</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/pull/352#discussion_r168303694">Comment by xtrasimplicity on line 7 of lib/cucumber/rails/configuration.rb</a>

2018-02-14 17:30:28

<p>If you'd like to, you could remove two lines by using <code>include Rack::Test::Methods if Cucumber::Rails.config.use_rack_test_helpers</code>. :)</p>

2018-04-10 04:29:24

[cucumber/cucumber-rails] aslakhellesoy commented on #373: [WIP] Use new tag negation syntax everywhere

<p>No, <code>no</code> is not a negation prefix. It should be <code>not</code>.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] brasmusson commented on #1283: Make --fail-fast play nice with --retry

<p>Since <code>Cucumber.wants_to_quit</code> is global and may be set to <code>true</code> by other components than the <code>FailFast</code> formatter, I think that it should only set <code>Cucumber.wants_to_quit</code> to false when it is sure that it is a flaky test that have passed.</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1283#discussion_r183216381">Comment by brasmusson on line 5 of lib/cucumber/formatter/fail_fast.rb</a>

B5YG6TPPA
2018-05-30 20:48:28

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] xtrasimplicity approved #1298: Use single quotes for snippets

B5YG6TPPA
2018-05-30 22:26:23

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] aslakhellesoy requested changes to #1298: Use single quotes for snippets

<p>To my knowledge, there aren't any <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4799796/ruby-coding-convention-for-single-or-double-quoting-your-strings">widely accepted conventions</a> for the use of single or double qutes.</p> <p>With Cucumber I prefer to use double quotes, because I use single quotes in steps relatively often:</p> <p><code>Given Aslak has joined Dana's game </code></p> <p>With double quotes I don't have to escape them in the Cucumber Expression.</p> <p>I mentioned in #1291 that using single quotes would be a workaround. I didn't mean that it would be a general solution to the problem.</p> <p>I think a better fix would be to keep the double quotes, and escape any <code>\</code> characters in the expression with <code>\\</code>.</p>
<p>Have you considered the case where <code>expr.source</code> contains a single quote?</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1298#discussion_r191991009">Comment by aslakhellesoy on line 5 of lib/cucumber/glue/snippet.rb</a>
<p>I think it's called curly braces, or just braces</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1298#discussion_r191991020">Comment by aslakhellesoy on line 53 of features/docs/defining_steps/snippets.feature</a>
B5YG6TPPA
2018-05-30 22:28:24

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] aslakhellesoy commented on #1298: Use single quotes for snippets

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] luke-hill commented on #1293: Add read access to task_name of Cucumber::Rake::Task

<p>Noticed this went stale. Seems a simple enough change, and one we have similar to in our modified Rakes inhouse.</p> <p>As Olle has mentioned though. I'd be interested to know about how this affects namespaces. I'd also probably want at least one positive test outside of a response test (As this doesn't actually verify the name being passed through the method chain is correct)</p>
<p>As this would be an instance method, tradition dictates this would probably be <code>#task_name</code> (Possibly just a typo on your behalf)</p>

Aslak Hellesøy
2020-03-06 08:39:51

@Vincent Pretre I think I’m finally done with this! https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1395

aslakhellesoy (https://github.com/aslakhellesoy)
#1395 Support --out http://....
<p><strong>Summary</strong></p> <p>Enables Cucumber to send results directly to a HTTP server</p> <p><strong>Details</strong></p> <p>Converts a string starting with <code>^http</code> to a custom <code>IO</code> object that performs a HTTP request</p> <p><strong>Motivation and Context</strong></p> <p>We want to make it easy for users to publish their results to external services. Allowing users to specify a URL to send results to should help.</p> <p>I'm fully aware that this is a fragile solution:</p> <p>• It will fail the execution if the server is unavailable • Doesn't support retry • Doesn't support proxies</p> <p>We will also provide guidelines about alternative, more robust mechanisms to publish results, such as:</p> <p>• Write messages to a file • Use cURL to publish after cucumber is done • Write messages to the CI server's "artifacts" directory and have a process somewhere else that can download them</p> <p><strong>How Has This Been Tested?</strong></p> <p>With WEBrick</p> <p><strong>Screenshots (if appropriate):</strong> <strong>Types of changes</strong></p> <p>☐ Refactor (code change that does not change external functionality) ☐ Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) ☑︎ New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality) ☐ Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)</p> <p><strong>Checklist:</strong></p> <p>☑︎ I've added tests for my code ☑︎ My change requires a change to the documentation. ☐ I have updated the documentation accordingly.</p>
Assignees
vincent-psarga
Labels
type: new feature
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1522

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1522#issuecomment-820856391|Comment on #1522 Comment object no longer included in the JSON output>
For more clarification, I'll refer to my above example scenario: ``` # testcase-11111 And I enter email # testcase-22222 testcase-33333 Then I should see the summary text under username and password fields Then I enter new account information And I tap the navigation tab video button # testcase-44444 testcase-55555 Then I should see the video feed ``` In the case that this scenario runs, but fails during the step: "Then I enter new account information", the scenario would resolve logically like the following: ``` # testcase-11111 And I enter email (PASSED) # testcase-22222 testcase-33333 Then I should see the summary text under username and password fields (PASSED) Then I enter new account information (FAILED) And I tap the navigation tab video button (SKIPPED) # testcase-44444 testcase-55555 Then I should see the video feed (SKIPPED) ``` In our automation repo, we integrate with a test case repository to generate reports of each run. In the above case, we would mark testcase-11111, testcase-22222, and testcase-33333 as PASSED. While we'd mark testcase-44444, and testcase-55555 as SKIPPED. This extra bit of info provides a lot of help across our many test cases; reducing debugging time, and giving us a better representation of the true failure rate of the app under test.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-15 19:16:25

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by mangjoze

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1524|#1524 Built-in html formatter generates a blank html report>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> When running my test using built-in html formatter, it generates a blank HTML file. Viewing the source of the html, I see a bunch of css and license stuff.</p> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:</p> <ol><li>Execute cucumber --format HTML --out report.html</li><li>Open the html report and html file is blank.</li> </ol> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong><br /> HTML report to be generated should not be blank.</p> <p><strong>Context &amp; Motivation</strong><br /> I can't report my test runs.</p> <p><strong>Environment</strong><br /> cucumber 6.0.0.<br /> ruby 2.7.0<br /> Windows 10</p>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

GitHub
2021-04-16 01:42:09

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1522

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1522#issuecomment-821020831|Comment on #1522 Comment object no longer included in the JSON output>
Comments are still part of the messages, they still exist, and are part of the message formatter. That mean that if you use `--format message --out report.ndjson`, you will have a report with step comments in it. It is not as human friendly as the json formatter, but maybe that may help you with your issue with some scripting? Also, that mean that maybe it is possible to update the json converter to bring back those comments.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-16 09:41:53

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1524

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1524#issuecomment-821301218|Comment on #1524 Built-in html formatter generates a blank html report>
<a href="https://github.com/mangjoze">@mangjoze</a> you should know that the html formatter doesn't generate a static HTML document. Rather, it generates an HTML page containing JSON data about your test run, and some JavaScript that should be able to render that JSON data into a nice-looking report. If the page is blank then it's probably because the JavaScript is failing for some reason. Can you check the developer tools console to see if there are any errors?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-16 11:09:47

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by aslakhellesoy

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1526|#1526 Allow using a HTTP proxy to send results>
<p>We should allow users behind a HTTP(S) proxy to publish results. See <a href="https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib-2.7.3/libdoc/net/http/rdoc/Net/HTTP.html#class-Net::HTTP-label-Proxies">https://ruby-doc.org/stdlib-2.7.3/libdoc/net/http/rdoc/Net/HTTP.html#class-Net::HTTP-label-Proxies</a></p>
Labels
✅ accepted, ⚡ enhancement
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 01:54:04

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1526

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1526#issuecomment-822296615|Comment on #1526 Allow using a HTTP proxy to send results>
We should make sure all implementations use the same environment variables to configure proxy settings. • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-jvm/issues/2285">cucumber/cucumber-jvm#2285</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-js/issues/1644">cucumber/cucumber-js#1644</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Pull request opened by jmoglesby

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1527|#1527 Clarify removal of `puts` in CHANGELOG>
<p>The original language of the changed item was rather confusing; it almost made it sound like the deprecation of <code>puts</code> was being reversed, and that <code>puts</code> is now preferred over <code>log</code>. But it also said that both <code>puts</code> <em>and</em> <code>log</code> were deprecated in 4.0. I don't think that's the case or the intention of this CHANGELOG point.</p> <p>My edits aim to make clear that <code>puts</code> has been deprecated, and the desire of the Cucumber Team is that <code>log</code> should be used in step definitions instead.</p>
Labels
📖 documentation
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 09:46:15

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1527

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1527#issuecomment-822617240|Comment on #1527 Clarify removal of `puts` in CHANGELOG>
That sounds good to me. <a href="https://github.com/aurelien-reeves">@aurelien-reeves</a> do you agree?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 10:35:19

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1527

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1527#issuecomment-822648445|Comment on #1527 Clarify removal of `puts` in CHANGELOG>
☝️:skin_tone_2: Upon re-reading the flow of the change items, I think I misunderstood the language flow from header to line items. So I switched the first line back to <a href="https://github.com/aurelien-reeves">@aurelien-reeves</a>' original. So the only change in this PR now is the removal of the statement that `log` was deprecated in v4.0.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 12:25:51

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#issuecomment-822725424|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
<a href="https://github.com/luke-hill">@luke-hill</a> thanks for your input, all are fixed
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 14:39:57

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1524#issuecomment-822815164|Comment on #1524 Built-in html formatter generates a blank html report>
The `embed` method has been renamed to `attach`: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#removed-1">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#removed-1</a> I assume this will make it work for you. If not, please make an <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example">mcve</a> and we'll reopen this issue.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r616351211|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
So it looks like we still need to generate a step def for this one, right? We need a way to make it fail once, but then pass on the second attempt? We can't store state in the World (the scenario context) as we get a fresh instance every time the scenario runs, so I'd be tempted to write a step def something like this: ``` step_definition('/^it fails once, then passes/', 'raise "eek" unless $flag;$flag = true') ``` Do you want to give that a try?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 22:22:49

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r616352232|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
Oh wait I see from the commit history you already tried something like that, sorry. Maybe I'm reading the code wrong but it seems like there's no step def for this step at the moment?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 23:23:13

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r616376739|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
It is actually. Every scenario has a `Background` statement where we create 3 step definition, one of them is used here. What i'm starting to realise is that `it fails once, then passes` step def has its own `${name}` variable. And when `it fails once, then passes` executes second time it isn't flaky anymore. Still the tests has the same fail reason as the "valid" one. I didn't really want to introduce 3rd flaky scenario e.g. fails 3 times and passes or something similar, seems it would look like a logic duplicate, but for now i have no other idea. Any thoughts guys?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-19 23:42:15

You can now push directly to this repo and all other repos under the cucumber organization! 🍾 In return for this generous offer we hope you will: • ✅ Continue to use branches and pull requests. When someone on the core team approves a pull request (yours or someone else's), you're welcome to merge it yourself. • 💚 Commit to setting a good example by following and upholding our <a href="https://cucumber.io/conduct">code of conduct</a> in your interactions with other collaborators and users. • 💬 Join the <a href="http://cucumber.io/support#slack">community Slack channel</a> to meet the rest of the team and make yourself at home. • ℹ️ Don't feel obliged to help, just do what you can if you have the time and the energy. • 🙋 Ask if you need anything. 2021-04-21 10:48:33

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1524

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1524#issuecomment-824244329|Comment on #1524 Built-in html formatter generates a blank html report>
<a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a>: &gt; Rather, it generates an HTML page containing JSON data about your test run, and some JavaScript that should be able to render that JSON data into a nice-looking report. Unfortunately, the way that’s done makes the Cucumber HTML report much less useful than it used to be. Back in the day, Cucumber used to use a similar approach to RSpec: it wrote straight HTML as scenarios ran, so that the file would render something useful in the browser before it was completely written. That makes it ideal for monitoring a long run with lots of scenarios. Current Cucumber HTML output, though, renders nothing until the run is complete (I think because `window.CUCUMBER_MESSAGES` isn’t well-formed JSON/JS till the final closing bracket is written), which means I need to wait for the entire run to finish before I see _any_ output. Is there an HTML formatter for current Cucumber that doesn’t have this drawback? I haven’t found one, and I really miss the old RSpec-like behavior. (And if this is off-topic, I’ll raise a new issue or ask on the list.)
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-21 11:26:33

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1524

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1524#issuecomment-824267664|Comment on #1524 Built-in html formatter generates a blank html report>
&gt; it wrote straight HTML as scenarios ran, so that the file would render something useful in the browser before it was completely written. That makes it ideal for monitoring a long run with lots of scenarios. In fact, this kind of live monitoring of a test run from a browser should now be easier to do, given that the results are streamed out as little `ndjson` packets. The problem would be getting that stream from your Cucumber process to your browser. It's a really cool idea, but yes it is off-topic for this thread I think :) If you're interested in pursuing it, let's create a new issue (in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber">https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber</a>) and discuss it there.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-22 13:54:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r618105947|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
I don't quite understand what you're saying :) What I understand is that there is already a "built-in" step def for `it fails once, then passes` which is created in the Background (which is why I didn't spot it in the diff). But you said "it isn't flaky anymore" - are you saying that when you use this step def it doesn't reproduce the problem you've seen in your own tests?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-22 13:54:17

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Review on #

Review on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-23 01:41:06

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r619046539|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
<a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a> let me come again: Yes, there is already built-in step for `it fails once, then passes`. Inside this step definition there is `$#{name}` initialization then the flakiness achieves by `"$#{name} += 1"` and `"expect($#{name}).to be &gt; 1"`. Since this step always runs as a `Background` refering to it second time gives true here without failing`"expect($#{name}).to be &gt; 1"` and does not simulates flakiness. This is why in order to use "built-in" step `it fails once, then passe` it is required to reset #{name} again, to do that i need to pass the same #{name} to both steps like this: ``` Background: Given a scenario "Fails-once" that fails once, then passes ``` and ``` Scenario: Flaky scenario gives zero exit code in no-strict-flaky mode if flaky step fails, passes and skips scenario And a scenario "Fails-once" that fails once, passes and then skips scenario ``` As for me it confuses and bcuz of this it stopes me to use pre-built flaky scenario. The only way i see now is to introduce new step e.g. `it three times, then passes` which gonna have its own `${name}`, this is how i was able to reproduce the bug in: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525/commits/e96c502e66ceb23fa6c410149d3735a8605184fb">this</a> commit, though it is not required for step to fail 3 times to reproduce the bug. Does it make sense to you?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-26 03:20:11

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1525

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1525#discussion_r620164544|Comment on #1525 add scenario for skip before flaky step>
To simplify all things, i would suggest to go for another similar step `it three times, then passes`, unless we decide to leave this test be as part of the suite. cc <a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

<p>As discussed at our last community meeting, the JSON formatter is no more deprecated, but entering maintenance mode.</p>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1528

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1528#discussion_r622870848|Comment on #1528 Remove deprecation for the JSON formatter>
I would go further with something like: `Prints the feature as JSON. The JSON format is in maintenance mode. Please consider using the message formatter with the standalone json-formatter (<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/tree/master/json-formatter>).` I think that someone with the need for formatting as json has not the same needs as someone which would benefit from the messages directly. Also we could add later a dedicated webpage for the json-formatter somewhere

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1529|#1529 `attach` fails when data is an array with a null byte>
<p><code>File#file?</code> raise an error when there is a null byte in the data, leading to the data being lost instead of being properly encoded and attached.</p> <pre><code>When('an array with {int} bytes is attached as plain/text') do |size| data = (0..size-1).map {|i| [i].pack('C') }.join attach(data, "text/plain") # path name contains null byte (ArgumentError) end </code></pre> <p>possible fix:</p> <pre><code> def attach(file, media_type = nil) return super unless File.file?(file) # snip... rescue return super end </code></pre>
Labels
🐛 bug
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-30 03:02:52

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1530|#1530 json formatter with empty scenarios report a background but not scenario>
<pre><code>Feature: minimal Scenario can be empty. Background and hooks are not executed. The state of the scenario is `undefined` Background: Given a background step Scenario: empty </code></pre> <p><code>bundle exec cucumber -f json</code></p> <p><strong>Actual</strong></p> <pre><code>[ { "description": " Scenario can be empty.\n Background and hooks are not executed.\n The state of the scenario is `undefined`", "elements": [ { "description": "", "keyword": "Background", "line": 6, "name": "", "type": "background" } ], "id": "minimal", "keyword": "Feature", "line": 1, "name": "minimal", "uri": "features/empty-scenario/empty-scenario.feature" } ] </code></pre> <p><strong>Expected</strong></p> <pre><code>[ { "description": " Scenario can be empty.\n Background and hooks are not executed.\n The state of the scenario is `undefined`", "elements": [ { "id": "minimal;empty", "keyword": "Scenario", "line": 9, "name": "empty", "steps": [], "type": "scenario" } ], "id": "minimal", "keyword": "Feature", "line": 1, "name": "minimal", "uri": "features/empty-scenario/empty-scenario.feature" } ] </code></pre>
Labels
🐛 bug
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-04-30 03:03:25

[cucumber/cucumber-rails] Issue closed by luke-hill

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/issues/439|#439 `install_cucumber_rails` &amp; Other legacy methods: Tidy up / Lint>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1532|#1532 Actor object in the step definition is not the same object that was created in the ParameterType definition>
<p><a href="https://gist.github.com/vincent-psarga/524cedeef9165b8ee0c66a7989cf70d7">https://gist.github.com/vincent-psarga/524cedeef9165b8ee0c66a7989cf70d7</a></p> <p>Also in shouty:<br /> <a href="https://github.com/vincent-psarga/shouty.rb/commit/015bf6ed752e3cf2a42beca268eceea57930b0e6">vincent-psarga/shouty.rb@015bf6e</a></p> <pre><code>Given Lucy is at 0, 0 # features/step_definitions/shout_steps.rb:10 Actor in parameter type: #&amp;lt;Actor:0x00007f9f984c5650&amp;gt; Actor in step definition: #&amp;lt;Actor:0x00007f9f984c4d40&amp;gt; </code></pre> <p>It has been introduced here: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/commit/1b9ab0fb15f1ae83959340463705cb80232918e5">1b9ab0f</a></p> <p>More context: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/760">#760</a></p>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Pull request opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1533|#1533 Report empty scenarios with the json formatter>
<p><strong>Is your pull request related to a problem? Please describe.</strong></p> <p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1530">#1530</a><br /> Empty scenarios are not reported in the json formatter.<br /> In order to standardize support for empty scenario, one has been added in the CCK: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/1498">cucumber/cucumber#1498</a></p> <p>cucumber-ruby has been chosen for reference, but yet the support could be improved.</p> <p>That is the purpose of that PR</p> <p><strong>Describe the solution you have implemented</strong></p> <p>We report empty scenarios in the json formatter, with an empty <code>steps</code> array</p>
Labels
🐛 bug
Reviewers
aslakhellesoy, vincent-psarga, brasmusson, luke-hill
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1533

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1533#discussion_r626597898|Comment on #1533 Report empty scenarios with the json formatter>
This has already been discussed a while ago here: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/issues/249">cucumber/cucumber#249</a> In order to properly close the issue, we have agree to open a PR to add an empty scenario in the compatibility kit: <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber/pull/1498">cucumber/cucumber#1498</a> Actually it looks like at least cucumber-ruby and cucumber-js are really close to the described behavior. It is just a matter of standardization and fixes like this PR

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1533

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1533#discussion_r626600573|Comment on #1533 Report empty scenarios with the json formatter>
This is first initialization of the background and test_case hashes here so it is safe. ``` @background_hash = { # snip... type: 'background', steps: [] } # ... @test_case_hash = { # snip... type: 'scenario', steps: [] } ```

[cucumber/cucumber-rails] Comment on #514

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-rails/issues/514#issuecomment-832956652|Comment on #514 Bug on 2.3.0 and MacOS BigSur message formatter not found>
No, no custom formatter, just built in Pretty and Message. An MVCE runs surprisingly - it must be a setting in our (larger) software. So on my side something is misconfigured. (For reference: it is this project: <a href="https://github.com/diaspora/diaspora">https://github.com/diaspora/diaspora</a> But I found out that I've enabled the cucumber Reporting by setting the CUCUMBER_PUBLISH_TOKEN environment var. Without this set, this works. It works and reports with a lower version than 2.320.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1532

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1532#issuecomment-838044609|Comment on #1532 Actor object in the step definition is not the same object that was created in the ParameterType definition>
<a href="https://github.com/aslakhellesoy">@aslakhellesoy</a> <a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a> <a href="https://github.com/tooky">@tooky</a> Since the introduction of the deep clone for step arguments, the following commit delegates the parameter type transformers to the World object <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/commit/144f34177efb9259c63e3f112edf85a47b11ce6b">144f341</a> That way, it seems the deep clone is no more required. I did some tests, and indeed, simply removing the deep clone seems to fix the issue still preventing undesirable state leaks. I'll submit a PR soon. WDYT?

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Pull request opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1538|#1538 Remove deep clone of step arguments>
<p>Fixes <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1532">#1532</a></p> <p>Step arguments are delegated to the World since <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/commit/144f34177efb9259c63e3f112edf85a47b11ce6b">144f341</a>.<br /> That prevent state to leak so the deep-clone seems not required anymore.</p> <p>But at the moment, I have no idea how to test that properly, and how to make sure state cannot leak</p>
Labels
🐛 bug, 🥒 core team, ✅ accepted
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-11 02:07:06

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1532

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1532#issuecomment-838120425|Comment on #1532 Actor object in the step definition is not the same object that was created in the ParameterType definition>
I've submitted the PR <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1538">#1538</a> But actually I have no idea how to test it properly, or how to make sure state effectively don't unexpectedly leak.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-11 02:12:45

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1538

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1538#issuecomment-838128698|Comment on #1538 Remove deep clone of step arguments>
The way to test this would be to write the feature as you have done, and validate they are same/diff objects. Also remember the world can have multiple modules registered and potentially a proc. So this feels like a tricky one to test / one that we could potentially have a lot of diff use cases.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-11 05:10:57

2021-05-11 06:34:34

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1538

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1538#issuecomment-838486208|Comment on #1538 Remove deep clone of step arguments>
I've been able to write a test to validate the use of the instance we created as part of the ParameterType proc. I've also added a test to check we do not modify the step argument itself in a step definition. It is based on another one in the same spec. But I was not able to make it fail in any circumstances so I do not know if it is relevant.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1540

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1540#discussion_r630859104|Comment on #1540 Fix dry run with messages>
I am stuck trying to add an acceptance test which reproduce the issue This is because the tested code is also the testing code. Because of that we cannot have acceptance tests based on the execution order of the filters in the runtime because it is actually executed a first time before executing the test itself. At the moment I have not been able yet to write a spec either.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by mattwynne

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1541|#1541 Tidy up coverals integration>
<p>Today we discovered a formatter class with no unit tests. There was a bug around this formatter, and the lack of unit tests made it harder to fix.</p> <p>Measuring code coverage from unit tests would have helped us to catch this problem sooner.</p> <p>☐ fix coverage badge on README ☐ add a bot (like in CucumberJS) to comment on PRs about the impact on code coverage</p>

matt-SmartBear
2021-05-14 07:35:57

*Thread Reply:* @Aslak Hellesøy those commits are attributed to cukebot - something up with your machine config?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-05-14 08:07:04

*Thread Reply:* @matt-SmartBear no, this is the CI process synching the monorepo to the read-only repos:

• https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/763170cd3a36e3023b55225fdad80498f9e0d521/Makefile#L53 • https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/763170cd3a36e3023b55225fdad80498f9e0d521/scripts/functions.sh#L76-L105

<https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/763170cd3a36e3023b55225fdad80498f9e0d521/Makefile | Makefile>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common">cucumber/common</a>
<https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/763170cd3a36e3023b55225fdad80498f9e0d521/scripts/functions.sh | functions.sh>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common">cucumber/common</a>
matt-SmartBear
2021-05-14 09:59:43

*Thread Reply:* Ah I missed which repo it was. This is one of the mirror repos we don't really need anymore, right?

Aslak Hellesøy
2021-05-14 10:56:42

*Thread Reply:* Yes - would be good to clean out the closet. I think we only need to keep the Go ones. It might even not be necessary to do it for go, if the go module system has been updated to support monorepos. I haven't investigated that.

matt-SmartBear
2021-05-15 21:41:19

*Thread Reply:* OK I've added https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/1550

<https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/1550|#1550 Clean up mirror repos>
<p>When we first moved to the monorepo, many of the package managers we used needed a library to be in it's own repo, so we set up individual read-only mirror repos which are copied to when there are changes in this repo.</p> <p>The context has changed, and we don't need most of these any more. We might still need them for the go modules.</p>
Labels
🏦 debt

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1540

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1540#issuecomment-842354875|Comment on #1540 Fix dry run with messages>
We decided that adding a test for this is too hard right now, as: 1. It's impossible to use an acceptance test, as the Runtime is already loaded in the acceptance tests 2. The formatter unit tests currently duplicate code from the runtime in a helper (see TODO added in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/commit/2667c931fc6109340449a3dd2ec4636bc6d82e53">2667c93</a>)

Hi <a href="https://github.com/eduardrudko">@eduardrudko</a>, Thanks for your making your first contribution to Cucumber, and welcome to the Cucumber committers team! You can now push directly to this repo and all other repos under the cucumber organization! 🍾 In return for this generous offer we hope you will: • ✅ Continue to use branches and pull requests. When someone on the core team approves a pull request (yours or someone else's), you're welcome to merge it yourself. • 💚 Commit to setting a good example by following and upholding our <a href="https://cucumber.io/conduct">code of conduct</a> in your interactions with other collaborators and users. • 💬 Join the <a href="http://cucumber.io/support#slack">community Slack channel</a> to meet the rest of the team and make yourself at home. • ℹ️ Don't feel obliged to help, just do what you can if you have the time and the energy. • 🙋 Ask if you need anything. We're looking for feedback about how to make the project more welcoming, so please tell us! On behalf of the Cucumber core team, Aslak Hellesøy Creator of Cucumber

2021-05-21 14:02:16

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1544

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1544#issuecomment-846257924|Comment on #1544 Upgrade messages and gherkin to bring new 'jsonschema messages'>
<a href="https://github.com/aslakhellesoy">@aslakhellesoy</a> I hadn't noticed that the change to the messages library had changed to exposing the messages as hashes instead of objects. It strikes me that it might be better to use wrap the bare message hashes in POROs, to give us an isolation layer so we don't need to make sweeping changes like this. Classes would also make it easier to document the messages with RDoc, and make the message protocol a bit more discoverable - hashes don't give good error messages if you typo a field name. It also might help prevent confusion like <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/issues/1559">cucumber/common#1559</a>. What do you think? Was the decision to use hashes over objects just a pragmatic one to get something released, or was there some more intent behind it?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-22 00:54:39

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1544

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1544#issuecomment-846371051|Comment on #1544 Upgrade messages and gherkin to bring new 'jsonschema messages'>
I like that suggestion <a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a>. To make it a reality, someone would have to build a code generator for ruby, similar to the one we have for go and typescript. The reason I went with hashes? It didn’t occur to me that we’d need classes. My main motivation for doing code generation have been: • TypeScript: type safety and default values in deserialisation • Go: Required for JSON output
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-22 00:59:33

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1544

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1544#issuecomment-846371589|Comment on #1544 Upgrade messages and gherkin to bring new 'jsonschema messages'>
There is additional complexity with classes. If you want to maintain backwards compatibility with the Ruby API, all attributes would have to be snake_case, but the JSON representation needs to be camelCase. I’m not convinced adding classes is worth it for ruby messages, because there are so few libs depending on it (AFAIK).
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-25 02:37:37

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1544

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1544#issuecomment-847717149|Comment on #1544 Upgrade messages and gherkin to bring new 'jsonschema messages'>
I would be in favor of DTOs to bring a more consistent public API over time, and to be more ruby-friendly too. Also, messages are consumed directly by formatters, so they may be used more than we could think of as I think custom formatters may be the first way to extend cucumber?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-25 03:03:44

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1544

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1544#issuecomment-847734909|Comment on #1544 Upgrade messages and gherkin to bring new 'jsonschema messages'>
Fair enough. The starting point would be to add a code generator for those DTOs as done here: • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/go/Makefile">https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/go/Makefile</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/javascript/Makefile">https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/javascript/Makefile</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/8abf7188dd83e462f7944fdb1be70a1c5ce54455/messages/jsonschema/scripts/codegen.rb#L157">https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/8abf7188dd83e462f7944fdb1be70a1c5ce54455/messages/jsonschema/scripts/codegen.rb#L157</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/8abf7188dd83e462f7944fdb1be70a1c5ce54455/messages/jsonschema/scripts/codegen.rb#L107">https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/8abf7188dd83e462f7944fdb1be70a1c5ce54455/messages/jsonschema/scripts/codegen.rb#L107</a> Then update code to use those DTO classes: • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/ruby/spec/cucumber/messages/ndjson_serialization_spec.rb">https://github.com/cucumber/common/blob/main/messages/ruby/spec/cucumber/messages/ndjson_serialization_spec.rb</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/tree/main/gherkin/ruby/lib/gherkin">https://github.com/cucumber/common/tree/main/gherkin/ruby/lib/gherkin</a> • <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/common/tree/main/demo-formatter/ruby">https://github.com/cucumber/common/tree/main/demo-formatter/ruby</a>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-25 08:22:12

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1542

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1542#discussion_r638903639|Comment on #1542 Improvement of welcoming documentation>
Suggested change
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/pull/1542#discussion_r638903773|Comment on #1542 Improvement of welcoming documentation>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1542

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by luke-hill

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1545|#1545 Taggable Rules not working in 6.1>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> Rules cannot be tagged in 6.1</p> <p><strong>To Reproduce</strong><br /> Steps to reproduce the behavior:</p> <pre><code>@tag @tag2 Feature: Foo Description Here @rule_tag Rule: Default Rule Background: Given a background step Scenario: My Scenario Given a step </code></pre> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong></p> <p>It works</p> <p><strong>Your Environment</strong></p> <p>• gherkin 18.1.1 • cucumber 6.1.0 • core 9.0.1 • Ubuntu 18.04 • Both CLI / RubyMine</p> <p><strong>Additional context</strong><br /> Stacktrace refers to UUID's not being found</p> <pre><code>No location found for ea3c5c3f-d060-49c3-b57f-db6e3f378b6d }. [cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by JoeSSS

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546|#1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
<p><strong>Describe the bug</strong><br /> The bug is quite confusing but I will try my best to describe it.</p> <p>When running a test with a background with a table like:</p> <pre><code>Background: Given user creates a group with the following properties: | group_name | Group name - [% Time.now %] | | group_type | SampleGroup | </code></pre> <p>the first test in the feature file runs fine. But the 2nd will fail in this case because it seems like <code>Time.now</code> will be the same for both test executions and the test won't be able to create duplicates (which I'm not sure is an expected behavior either). As soon as the 2nd scenario will fail, the run will be immediately terminated with the stack trace shared below, and the Cucumber will "crash" and not finish gracefully (no reports or meaningful error message).</p> <p><strong>Expected behavior</strong><br /> The test is terminated with a proper error.</p> <p><strong>Context &amp; Motivation</strong></p> <p>The issue is not easy to reproduce, but when it happens it is quite bad since the whole run is terminating and a re-run will see 0 tests and will finish as a success. So we basically had the problem for quite a while without knowing we have failing tests.</p> <p><strong>Stacktrace</strong></p> <pre><code>negative argument (ArgumentError) /Users/joes/.rvm/gems/ruby-2.7.1/gems/activesupport-6.1.3.2/lib/active_support/core_ext/string/indent.rb:10:in `**' [cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Issue opened by aurelien-reeves

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1547|#1547 The pretty formatter does not report rules>
<p>From a Slack conversation here: <a href="https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/archives/C7676D8GN/p1622078810002700">https://cucumberbdd.slack.com/archives/C7676D8GN/p1622078810002700</a></p> <p>When running <code>$ cucumber --format pretty</code> on a file that uses the “Rule” keyword, with Cucumber 6, should I be seeing the Rules print out to the console along with the Features and Scenarios? I have my file formatted like this:</p> <pre><code>Feature: ... Rule: ... Scenario: ... Given When Then </code></pre> <p>But I am not seeing the Rules print out to the console.</p> <p>Note: the pretty formatter is hard to maintain</p> <p>Suggestion: having the pretty formatter rewritten into the monorepo to use shared testdata and have a consistent behavior in different languages.</p>
Labels
🏦 debt, 🐛 bug, ✅ accepted
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 00:11:10

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850201549|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
Thanks for the report. How looks your corresponding step definition? How do you replace `Time.now`? I am pretty new to cucumber. I never see that `[% %]`. Is this something built-in into cucumber/gherkin? Or something you are using yourself as some kind of templating like erb? However, as you said, it looks like <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/620">#620</a>
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 00:20:30

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1547

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1547#issuecomment-850206778|Comment on #1547 The pretty formatter does not report rules>
If we do this, it we should also consider how we support Markdown. Markdown produces the same AST as Gherkin classic, so as long as the formatter uses the AST there would be no special considerations. Another way to support Markdown is to pribt the source, but with additional Markup to represent results. That way the output would be valid Markdown with results, and without the need for JavaScript to render it.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 00:53:36

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1547

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1547#issuecomment-850226334|Comment on #1547 The pretty formatter does not report rules>
I am confused here. May the pretty formatter be used for something else than plain text primarily to stdout?
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 01:20:23

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1547

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1547#issuecomment-850242582|Comment on #1547 The pretty formatter does not report rules>
The output would be human readable, but if you chose to redirect it to a file, it could also be rendered by a markdown processor.

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850340639|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
This is something we use for templating. I tried to remove the [% things and still getting the same result. It feels to me that it is because we are doing operations on these objects passed in the Background, but somehow they are shared with the next test, which I personally do not expect
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850405466|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
Thanks for the clarification 👍
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 07:45:58

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850471029|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
Seems to me it might be a clash with ActiveSupport's `String#indent` method and <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/blob/main/lib/cucumber/core_ext/string.rb">this monkey patch</a> of our own. I suggest that the fix would be to remove our monkey patch on `String` and make that method a static/helper method somewhere, e.g. on `Cucumber::Formatter::Console` <a href="https://github.com/JoeSSS">@JoeSSS</a> would you be interested in attempting a PR for that? We can give you all the support you need.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 11:20:31

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850590099|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
<a href="https://github.com/mattwynne">@mattwynne</a> I tried removing the patch but it did not help. I tried to reproduce the issue and create a sample project with it for a couple of hours but couldn't find any common sense in the way the issue reproduces.. For the moment I fixed it just by moving the background to each step and removing the background section. What I see when trying to reproduce is that even making the step and step definition shorter helps to stop getting the issue. But also this steps does a couple of API calls and remembers their answers and if I just stop doing one of the calls, the issues disappear again. So it looks like something is just overflows and I do not understand what. For me, the main suspicion is still the fact that variables are shared between the tests with background, I tried to print the Time.now that we pass from the table and both tests have given me the same result, but they were supposed to execute `Time.now` with at least a couple of seconds diff since I put a sleep there. ``` Background: # features/Test.feature:4 Group 2021-05-28 20:18:06 +0200 Given with the following properties via API: # features/step_definitions/test_steps.rb:1 | group_name | Group [% Time.now %] | Scenario: One # features/Test.feature:11 Scenario: Two # features/Test.feature:15 Group 2021-05-28 20:18:06 +0200 ```
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 12:56:31

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850640219|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
I don't think it's a matter of just removing the monkey patch. The problem you're experiencing I think, like in <a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/620">#620</a>, that you're getting ActiveSupport's version of `String#indent` instead of ours. So removing ours won't make any difference.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
GitHub
2021-05-28 13:01:59

[cucumber/cucumber-ruby] Comment on #1546

<https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby/issues/1546#issuecomment-850642734|Comment on #1546 Cucumber terminating with `negative argument` while trying to process a failing background step with a table>
What we need to do is _move_ ours (but still use it) so they don't get mixed up with each other.
<a href="https://github.com/cucumber/cucumber-ruby">cucumber/cucumber-ruby</a>
